en_source:

nllb_uz_to_en: Balkh traffic manager Ning Kope Yetrishiche: "Currently in Yellowknife, Balkh-Juzhan and Balkh-Smangan have been involved in 122 traffic accidents, resulting in 108 fatalities and 160 fatalities".

en_source: "The more foreign citizens come to Afghanistan for investment or tourism purposes, the better it is," he told Salam Watandar, "because their arrival brings some foreign currency into the country's economic cycle, and on the other hand, Afghanistan's interaction with the world increases."

en_source: Meanwhile, the Taliban-controlled Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, citing the United States Geological Survey, has reported that from January to August of the current year, 246 earthquakes have occurred in Afghanistan, with the highest registering at 5.9 on the Richter scale.

en_source:

KABUL (BNA): The interim government of Pakistan has announced that, despite security threats, the general elections in the country will proceed as scheduled.

en_source:

en_source: Mawlavi Abdul Wali Haqqani, the Deputy Minister of Health Services, shared information during the event about expanding health services to remote areas, equitable distribution of health services, improving quality with modern technology, access to services through new health centers, controlling drug prices, and strengthening public health systems.

en_source:
350 Deaths from Acute Respiratory Infections in Afghanistan Last Month
The World Health Organization (WHO) has announced that 350 people have died due to acute respiratory infections in Afghanistan over the past month.

nllb_uz_to_en: Acute respiratory failure in Afghanistan has resulted in 350 deaths at 8am, Kabul: Worldwide tensions have been declared in Afghanistan.Acute respiratory failure in Afghanistan has resulted in 350 deaths.

KABUL (BNA): Mawlavi Noor Jalal Jalali, the Minister of Public Health, in a meeting with Taria Waterdahl, the Head of the Norwegian Committee for Afghanistan, emphasized the provision of health services in accordance with the country's National Health Strategy.

en_source:
OCHA: Climate Crises Amplify Humanitarian Needs in Afghanistan
On World Environment Day, the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) stated that the climate crisis has intensified humanitarian needs in Afghanistan.

اوچا: اقیلیمی بحرانلر افغانستان ده انسان سېورلیک یاردملرگه بۉلگن ضرورتلرگه شدت بغیشله گن

Butunjahon atrof-muhit kunida Birlashgan Millatlar Tashkilotining Gumanitar masalalarni muvofiqlashtirish boshqarmasi (OCHA) iqlim inqirozi Afg'onistonda insonparvarlik ehtiyojlarini kuchaytirganini ta'kidladi.

nllb_uz_to_uz: Ocha: Iqlim inqirozlari Afg'onistonda inson ehtiyoji bilan ta'minlangan ehtiyojlar ko'payib bormoqda 8-sahar, Kabul: Yesh muhit yaratilmoqda Birlashgan Millatlar ittifoqi Birlashgan Millatlar Tashkilotining inson ehtiyoji bilan ta'minlangan ehtiyojlar ko'payib bormoqda Uygunlshtirovichi idorasi (Ocha) Birlashgan Millatlar Ittifoqi iqlim inqirozi bilan ta'minlangan ehtiyojlar ko'payib bormoqda.

en_source:
Guterres: 22.9 Million People in Afghanistan Need Urgent Aid in 2025
Antonio Guterres, the United Nations Secretary-General, has stated that in the current year, 22.9 million people in Afghanistan require life-saving assistance due to ongoing food insecurity and malnutrition, population displacement, natural hazards, climate shocks, a strained economy, and limited access to basic services.

en_source:
HRCP: Concerns Raised Regarding Pakistani Government's Ill-Treatment of Afghan Refugees
The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) has expressed deep concern over the mistreatment of Afghan refugees by the Pakistani government in Sindh, Islamabad, Balochistan, and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, describing it as "alarming."
